page.title: 07WALKINGTON_EVENTS & MEDIA.
page.content: TO HONOUR THE WINNING BY VILLAGE GIRL SUE HEARNSHAW OF THE LOS ANGELES OLYMPIC GAMES LONG JUMP BRONZE MEDAL, SHE WAS WELCOMED HOME AND A PLAQUE AND BRONZE STRIPS THE WINNING 6.80m APART LAYED NEAR THE VILLAGE POND. NEWS IS SPREAD BY THE MONTHLY VILLAGE MAGAZINE OR THE NOTICE BOARD.BUS TIMES AND ADVERTS ARE DISPLAYED IN THE SHOP. THE BEVERLEY GUARDIAN AT 20% OR HULL DAILY MAIL 53% READERS,GIVE AREA NEWS BUT 36% OF PEOPLE DON'T BUY THEM.THE 3 FREE PAPERS ARE READ BY 75%,BUT MAINLY FOR ADVERTS.RADIO VIKING,17%,OR RADIO HUMBERSIDE 32% OF LISTNERS,SERVE US. 3 HOMES HAD NO TV BUT 37% HAD A VIDEO AND 15% OTHER ADDITIONS eg TELETEXT, CEEFAX OR ORACLE.OF 214 1 HAD PRESTEL 30% HOMES HAD NO NATIONAL DAILY PAPER BUT TELEGRAPH 19%,EXPRESS 15%,MAIL 10% YORKSHIRE POST 9%,TIMES AND GUARDIAN 7.5% EACH OF PAPERS READ,WERE THE MAIN
